Tester

The tester class is the one responsible for initializing the testing cycle, its one of the entry points to working with the module.

class model.tester.Tester(respath: str, env_config: dict, agent_models: list, emb: str, app: str, alg: str, rwt: str, srp: tuple)

Initializes a tester object to tests an agent and calculate MRR & Hits@N metrics.

Parameters

  • respath – path to save the tests to.

  • env_config – the configuration file for this testing session.

  • agent_models – the list of agents to test. if length is 2 its assumed to be PPO algorithm or BASE if its length 1.

  • emb – the embedding to use for testing.

  • app – the action picking policy for the agent.

  • alg – the algorithm to use.

  • rwt – the reward type to use.

  • srp – the tuple containing the single relation pair info -> (is_single_rel:bool, relation_name:str)

The functions for the class are the following.

model.tester.Tester.run(self)

Executes the tests defined in the initialization and generates analytical metrcis from them.

Returns

hits_at -> the Hits@ metric calculated for the agent. MRR -> the MRR metric calculated for the agent.

OR

False -> if the testing fails, the captured stack is printed and False is returned.

model.tester.Tester.generate_MRR_boxplot_and_source(self, MRR: list)

Saves the source data obtained from testing into a res.txt file

Parameters

MRR – the list of integers denoting the rank of the calculated paths.

model.tester.Tester.generate_found_paths_files(self, found_paths: list)

Writes all calculated paths into a paths.txt file

Parameters

found_paths – the list of paths found.

model.tester.Tester.path_contains_entity(self)

checks the list of visited entities and checks if the target has been visited.

Returns

True if target has been visited, False otherwise.

model.tester.Tester.set_gpu_config(self, use_gpu: bool)

if GPU is found and is usable by tensorflow, configures it.

Parameters

use_gpu – wether to use the GPU or not.

model.tester.Tester.update_gui_vars(self, tot_steps: Optional[int] = None, curr_step: Optional[int] = None, progtext: Optional[str] = None)

Auxiliary function to update the GUI parameters for progess updates.

Parameters

  • tot_steps – the total training step that are queued.

  • curr_step – the current training step.

  • progtext – the text to be displayed as progess info.
